About Me

Hi, my name is Bin Choi. I’m a junior backend developer and a third-year student at Yale-NUS College. I am currently studying Computer Science at Aalto University in Finland as an exchange student.

I enjoy logical problem solving and am deeply fascinated by the intersection of Medicine and Computer Science. Working with Spring Boot has taught me the power of a well-structured MVC framework and test-driven development. I have worked with a range of different languages and frameworks and am always looking for opportunities to work with something new. The languages that I currently have the most experience working with are: Java, Python, Scala, R, OCaml, and Bash/Linux.

The idea of being able to create new services that positively impact the lives of countless people is the driving force behind my back-end development journey.

Projects

Habit Racer

github.com/binchoi/habit-racer

Transforming habit building into an exciting competition against friends and families.

Building new habits is difficult. Whether it be exercising, solving leetcode problems, reading, or all three (if you’re like me), it is incredibly easy to let a budding habit die. I started this project in hopes of transforming habit building into an exciting, multi-player game, like beer pong. With the ability to set wagers for each race, Habit Racer will not only keep you accountable but invested.

I learned many new tools and skills in the process of building this project. These include Spring Boot 2, AWS, MariaDB, JUnit, and Java.

Experience

The Boring Company

Senior Network System Administrator

November 2017 - Present

boringcompany.com

Solving 21st century problems by diging holes and making game changing products like the *not a flamethrower*

Every company needs its networks properly administered and The Boring Compay is no exception. Digging holes is hard and I play my part making sure the whole company stays connected. I lead a team of 5 people and enjoy driving the company to try new technologies.

Education

Yale-NUS College

BSc Mathematical, Computational, and Statistical Science (Computer Science track)

2019 - 2023

Established in 2011 as a collaboration between Yale University and the National University of Singapore, Yale-NUS College is the first liberal arts college in Singapore. With an admit rate ranging from 3% to 7%, Yale-NUS College is an intimate liberal arts college dedicated to a community of learning. Founded by two great universities, In Asia, for the world.
